column1: Prognathism may be a symptom of other syndromes or conditions.
An extended (protruding) jaw can be part of a person's normal face shape that is present at birth.
Your primary health care provider should also be involved to check for underlying medical disorders that can be associated with prognathism.
Call a health care provider if: - You have difficulty talking, biting, or chewing related to the abnormal jaw alignment.
The health care provider will perform a physical examination and ask questions regarding your medical history.
